body:
Hi Mostapha, hi guys!

I am working on a project in Tromsø, Northern-Norway. I found climate data on [https://www.byggforsk.no/side/56/tek-sjekk_energi](https://www.byggforsk.no/side/56/tek-sjekk_energi) (under "Klimadata"), but i.m attaching it too.

I was facing several problems during importing it to Ladybug, I renamed .EPW to .epw, removed the "ø" character, but still it.s missing mtx files.

I.m kinda out of ideas, can you take a look on it?

replies.body:
Try deleting the spaces in the name of the file.

-A.

Even though I rename the epw files, he creates a new set in C:\Ladybug with other names (with "ø"), and without the mtx files [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/lBmMlUwM9ZdPWr6CPUFr8SpA6O3nqLRff832mK6XpqowkspahzE8UBmQw4p6YABDyr9P*y9jDzRrnFPKZE0xePiQD25xFtrT/totto_ladybugproblem2.JPG) This is the result after renaming the original file to "tromso.epw" :D I didn.t find where can I change these mechanics. Or if still the "ø" is the problem.

The problem is inn the header of the EPW file. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/lBmMlUwM9ZfZwMDRqRn2DRQxNcKGke*v64fRhEOiofecOyTQDXwS5Mbq0gC*C3izcfd1SoCTQmzZQnebiwPfAg24GCrcf3am/Capture.JPG)Edit the file with any text editor program and replace this letter for something like "o" (Tromso). It will work. -A.
